result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon Schuman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue Worthless Check. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine is to be paid as follows:  $50 is due on or before 2-1-17 and then $50 is due by the 1st of each month thereafter until paid in full.  A $15 payment plan fee has been added to the payment plan.  Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendat appears with SPD Travis Satorius.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Attorney Satorius states they have an agreement to amend to civil ordinance violation and he has a money order for the restitution which he gives to DA in court.  DA Fox moves to amend to Jackson County Ordinance for Issuing of Worthless Check with a forfeiture of $10 plus costs.  Motion to amend is granted - pleads no contest.  Court finds him guilty and imposes the $10 plus costs = $217.10 to pay at $50 per month commencing 2-1-17 with FTP 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
STC rescheduled at request of Atty Satorius; ok'd with T.D. in DA's office.
Status conference on December 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on November 16, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on December 5, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Satorius.  Waive reading of the complaint.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  PTC set for 11/16 and STC 12/5 at 3 pm.  Bond continued.
Not to issue any checks during the pendency of the action.  Report for booking.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 24, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Not to issue any checks during the pendency of the action.  Report for booking.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and without counsel.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties contained in the complaint.  He understood.  He will call SPD.  AIA set for 10/24 at 9 am.
Initial appearance on October 17, 2016 at 09:00 am.
